context: Prologue — A young racer introduces the underground scene. Gateway to The Pit.

lines.text: TORRES AUTO — THREE DAYS LATER. Late afternoon. You're under the CRX when a modified Civic pulls into the lot, bass thumping.

A kid — maybe nineteen, maybe younger — hops out with the energy of someone who's had too much energy drink and not enough sleep. He's wearing a racing jacket two sizes too big and a grin that hasn't learned about consequences yet.

lines.speaker: Young Racer
lines.text: Yo! Maya! You in?

lines.speaker: Maya Torres
lines.text: Tommy. What did I tell you about revving in my parking lot?

lines.speaker: Tommy
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, sorry. Listen — big news. The Pit is open tonight. Kai's running a fresh meat bracket. Five hundred entry, winner takes two grand.
Tommy notices you sliding out from under the CRX. He looks at the car, then at you, then back at Maya.

lines.speaker: Tommy
lines.text: Who's this? New hire? Hey — you race?

lines.speaker: Maya Torres
lines.text: Don't even think about it, Tommy.

lines.speaker: Tommy
lines.text: What? I'm just asking! The Pit's always looking for new blood. Fresh meat bracket means low-tier cars only. Even that thing—
He points at the CRX.

lines.speaker: Tommy
lines.text: —could technically qualify. If it runs. Does it run?

lines.speaker: Maya Torres
lines.text: Tommy. Enough.

lines.speaker: Tommy
lines.text: Alright, alright. Just saying — The Pit, tonight, ten PM, under the Harborview overpass. Five hundred gets you in. And Maya — Kai says he still owes you for that transmission job.
Tommy hops back in his Civic and peels out of the lot, leaving tire marks Maya will definitely make him clean up later.
The garage is quiet again. Maya is staring at the door where Tommy left. She hasn't moved.

lines.speaker: Maya Torres
lines.text: Don't.
She turns to look at you. She already knows what you're thinking.

lines.speaker: Maya Torres
lines.text: The Pit is not a parking lot race. It's organized. It's dangerous. People get hurt. Cars get totaled. And $500 is everything you have.

lines.speaker: Maya Torres
lines.text: Your car isn't ready. YOU aren't ready. Give it time. Build up, learn the streets, save your money.

lines.label: maya_response_solo
lines.text: Maya's expression goes cold. Not angry — something worse. Disappointed.

lines.speaker: Maya Torres
lines.text: Just like that? Three days and you already think you know better than me?

lines.speaker: Maya Torres
lines.text: Fine. Go. Wreck the car I've been fixing on my own time. But when you limp back here — and you WILL limp back — don't expect me to say I told you so.

lines.speaker: Maya Torres
lines.text: I'll just fix whatever's left.

lines.label: maya_response_together
lines.text: Maya blinks. Whatever she expected you to say, it wasn't that.

lines.speaker: Maya Torres
lines.text: Come with — are you serious right now?
She stares at you. You don't look away. Something passes between you — an understanding that neither of you could put into words.

lines.speaker: Maya Torres
lines.text: I know those streets. I know that crowd. And I know your car better than you do.

lines.speaker: Maya Torres
lines.text: If you're going to do something stupid, at least have someone smart in the passenger seat. I'll be your eyes. Don't make me regret this.

lines.label: maya_response_pragmatic
lines.speaker: Maya Torres
lines.text: What if you win? Two thousand dollars. Enough to buy real parts for the CRX. Enough to actually compete.

lines.speaker: Maya Torres
lines.text: And what if you lose? You're out five hundred — that's your food money, your safety net, your everything. One bad turn, one blown tire, and you're walking home with nothing.
She studies your face. Looking for doubt. She doesn't find any.

lines.speaker: Maya Torres
lines.text: You've already decided, haven't you? I can see it. Same look you had when you told me your story.

lines.speaker: Maya Torres
lines.text: Go. But if anything goes wrong — and it will — you call me. I mean it.

lines.label: pit_end
lines.text: NIGHT FALLS. The city transforms. Streetlights flicker on one by one. Somewhere in the distance, an engine revs.
You sit in the CRX. The engine turns over — rough, reluctant, but alive. Maya did good work. The brakes are new. The intake is patched. It's not fast, but it's not dead.
$500 sits in your pocket. Everything you have in the world.
You pull out of Torres Auto and point the CRX toward the harbor. Toward The Pit. Toward the beginning of everything.
